column1: shortish down the leg side, poor line to start the match, and Tamim merely tucks it off his pads, fine enough for a four
much better line. Angles it away a bit, well outside off on length so left alone
short of length on middle stump, no room and Tamim helps it to midwicket
opens Tamim up a bit with an accurate line on off stump, he opens the face of the bat and runs it to third man
nice and accurate line outside off, Liton defends it watchfully
bit closer to the off stump now, Liton stays back and defends again
finds swing straightaway, lovely away movement but it's pretty wide and just inside the wide line. Left alone

such accuracy, and he strikes! Boult pitches that up on off stump, making Tamim drive but there's some outswing and he's edged it to the keeper. Tamim, though, was driving with a closed bat towards the leg side, instead of driving it straight down the ground. Boult did his job though with the length, the away movement and the edge
right in the block hole now to welcome the new batsman. No margin for error whatsoever and Soumya digs it out of the ground
almost a replay of the Tamim wicket delivery and Soumya watchfully blocks it by getting behind the ball

that's short and Soumya does well to get on top of that and pull that away to the square-leg boundary. Not sure what Boult tried with the short ball but it was a bit too short and Soumya pulled it away with style
back to his outswingers outside off and the batsman lets it go but withdrawing his bat just in time

on the pads, loud appeal from Henry, but it's angling in a fair bit after pitching on middle and would've probably missed. Liton tried to clip it away to leg but missed and was hit on the front pad in front of leg
teases him with an away-swinger outside off, he pokes and misses
bangs it in short, there's some nice shape too, and Liton stays back to defend it on his toes
angles it in towards the stumps again with a length delivery, Liton helps it to fine leg with a thick inside edge
length delivery on leg stump, Soumya defends it back with his head down
bit too wide and what a beauty from Soumya. Stays back absolutely still and caresses that though the cover-point region with a back-foot punch by using the angle of the ball
loud, loud appeal for lbw as he swings this one in, Liton hasn't moved his feet at all and is trapped on the back foot. But the ball is bouncing a fair bit and that probably saves Liton
on the stumps from Boult and he defends it on the leg side
creamed through the covers this time, four more! He needs only a bit of room, some outswing, and Soumya leans into that drive to send it rolling along the ground in the gap in the covers
back towards the stumps again and Soumya defends it back
headed right towards off and middle, Soumya stays back and blocks it off the middle
full on off, hint of outswing, and Soumya flicks it to mid-on by just checking his shot

that's gone right through Liton! No footwork whatsoever from him as the ball nips in from length outside off, he leaves a wide gap between bat and ball, not accounting for the line and the movement, and the ball goes on to clip top of off stump. He was looking out of place against Henry in the previous over and the bowler cashed in on that
accurate line on the off stump, length delivery, and he defends carefully
slightly wide outside off, het shoulders arms this time
makes him play this time with an off-stump line, nice bounce and Mushfiqur defends with a straight bat
from slightly wide of the crease to bring the ball in with the angle, Mushfiqur watches that and blocks again
more towards the leg stump now with the angle, he defends towards midwicket now
nice shape and swing just around off stump, pretty full, he pushes it into the covers
towards the pads now, Soumya needs only a small error from the bowler and he clips that away nicely in the air through the vacant midwicket region for a four
short ball, he hooks, gets a top edge, shouts of 'catch it' but it's gone slightly fine to beat long leg and gets four more
eases into that drive nicely to send it in the cover region for two in the gap. Bit too full and nicely done by Soumya
angling in a bit this time into Soumya, he tucks it to midwicket

loud, loud appeal for lbw, umpire S Ravi won't move at all, there were two noises probably and NZ review that after Williamson walks in from cover. The length delivery is swinging in, he looked to clip it to leg and got an inside edge just before the ball hit the pads. New Zealand lose their review
angling in towards the pads from length, clipped straight to midwicket
pretty short and wide, Mushfiqur gets room and cuts but only bottom-edges it towards third man
what a shot for six! That looked like a normal short ball towards Soumya but he saw the length so early, and smacked that to the square leg boundary, hitting a six out of nowhere! Almost breathtaking
back towards the stumps, no use bowling short to him, and it's pushed into the covers for one
off stump line from Henry, no room at all, and he blocks it back
gives him the charge by dancing down the track, Mushfiqur is not going to get dominated, makes room too and he smashes that down the ground, straight enough to beat mid-off
little bit of away swing outside off, Soumya pushes it away from his body and gets an inside edge to fine leg

Mushfiqur has been hit on the helmet, but he looks fine. That was a nasty short ball on the leg side, Mushfiqur went on his toes and took his eyes off the ball with his hands in front of his face, and the ball bounced enough to bounce off the helmet to reach Guptill at square leg
oh another bouncer! This one around middle and off and Mushfiqur lets it go easily
nicely pitched just outside off, bit of angle, tempting line to poke but Mushfiqur resists the temptation and leaves it
length delivery on off, Mushfiqur watches carefully and defends by leaning into that delivery

oh, he's chopped it on! Mushfiqur was doing well in that over after taking a blow on the helmet. He was judging the lines well, leaving and defending them. This delivery nips in just a bit after pitching outside off, Mushfiqur goes for the cut and the movement takes his inside edge to rattle off stump
length delivery around off, driven straight to cover off the front foot

Soumya has been bounced out here and Bangladesh lose the biggest wicket of the day. Henry banged it in short, Soumya went for the hook and got a top edge that went high enough for Henry to run towards the short leg region to get under it just in time
targets the off stump from wide of the crease, on length, Mahmudullah gets an inside edge to fine leg. He's off the mark
takes it away from his first ball, that teasing line outside off, he goes for the drive and misses it completely
pushes this one into the covers again, but it nips in a bit and takes an inside edge to the leg side
uses soft hands to guide that length delivery towards third man
starts with a leg-stump line on the pads, doesn't bounce much and he helps it to leg
bangs it in, another bouncer from Boult, and he ducks under it
pushes that full delivery down the ground towards mid-off and takes off for the single immediately to make it in time
tempting line outside off to have a go, 141kmh, good angle too but he lets it go
stifled appeal for lbw as he swings this one in, Mithun is falling over while trying to clip it. It pitched on leg, maybe just outside, and was going down further to not move S Ravi again
tries a similar delivery but it's too full this time, a low full toss, and Mithun gets enough bat to clip it fine for four. Bangladesh need those runs
just outside off and he defends it away towards point
uses soft hands this time for the length delivery outside off, gets a thick edge to third man
outside off again, he watches carefully and defends
little too wide this time and het lets it go
back towards the stumps from length, no room at all, and he defends it back
back of length around off stump, he stays back and defends it towards point
too wide outside off, he reaches out for it away from his body and drives it square. Point gets a hand to it with a dive and they take two
better line closer to off stump, almost makes Mahmudullah play that one. He pokes and misses
a bouncer this time on the leg side, he ducks under it easily
too wide again outside off, Boult losing his line a bit, and it's left alone again

the short ball has done it, looks like an edge because of the sound but Mahmudullah has reviewed straightaway. Boult banged it in short, it opened the batsman up who held his bat in front of the shoulders. Snicko and replays show there was nothing off the bat, it was the right shoulder instead. DRS to the rescue
beats the outside edge again with that teasing line, away movement and accuracy. He pokes and misses
shapes it away nicely but well outside off, left alone
nipping it in this time towards off stump, he pushes it back
some away swing again well outside off, Mithun throws his hands at it but finds mid-off
well outside off, Mithun waits and then sticks his bat out to help it to third man
121kmh, pretty innocuous outside off, pushed down to mid off again
119kmh, touch shorter with some away movement on off stump, he defends it off the back foot
from well wide of the crease and angling in sharply towards middle and leg, Mithun brings his bat down just in time to defend
similar release point but it's outside off now, he leans forward a bit and pushes it on off
short ball this time outside off, Mithun hangs back and keeps the ball down for a single to third man
pushes at the short of length ball away from his body outside off, inside edge beats leg gully for one
angling in sharply towards the batsman, he works it behind square in the vacant area for two
beats the outside edge! That was 150kmh, that was on length, that was something he wanted to defend but could not, Mithun
length delivery on middle, he defends it back
bit of room outside off with some shape, he steers it to point
closer to the off stump, Mahmudullah leans forward and blocks
more on the off stump, no room and he defends again
bit of room this time and he drives it nicely through the covers
too wide this time, poor line, he drives it nicely off the middle but straight to cover
length ball pushed down leg side, can't get bat on that
short ad just outside off, jumps up to get on top of the bounce and punches to point
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot

just past square leg! Or did he get a finger on that? Santner flying to his right. Lockie's short one gets big on Mahmudullah who fends in front of his chest with a closed face and gets it aerailly down to fine leg. 147kph bouncer, that
153kph and fizzing past the outside edge as he's late on the forward defence
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
149.2kph, short ball, too wide, easily left alone
steered nicely with the swing. Length and shaping away wide outside off. Reaches out and opens the face late to get this to sweeper's left
length and some curve away outside off. Opens the face on the front foot and gets it to third man
shot! Majestic. Length ball just outside off, skips down at it and stands tall as he punches this aerially between bowler and mid-off
length on middle stump, mistimed drive to mid-on
top edge is well short of fine leg. It's a short one outside off. It is also a slower ball. No control on the hooks but he's safe
full on leg stump, clipped straight to deep backward square
beaten on the outside edge. Feet stuck in the crease. 151.1kph in the corridor and all his stumps are visible as he swishes at this
bouncer dug in too short and climbs over his helmet

taken, second attempt! Taylor reacts quicker to that than the batsman, but he has catching up to do as well. 150kph again from Ferguson. It's short and in the corridor, slanting in at the batsman. It's there for the cut, and that's what Mahmudullah looks to do. But this is just too quick for him and he gets the outside edge. Taylor lunges to his right and pops it up before keeping his head and grabbing it as it lobs behind him at first slip
short and up at off stump. Gets on top of the bounce to defend this
154.9kph yorker just outside off. Looks to jam this through the off side but too late
short and up at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and wide outside off, sliced to third man's right off the front foot
short of a length at off stump, opens the face and runs it to point. Sent back as he looks to pinch a run
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
length at off, pushed to point off the back foot
short of a length and floating away wide outside off. Opens the face too early as he looks to run it down to third man. Under-edges to the keeper
length on off stump, defended from the crease
length on leg stump, clipped to fine leg off the back foot
drilled to the point boundary. Nice shape on this drive from Sabbir. It's full and quite wide outside off, but he's leaned into his after getting onto his knees. Past cover point
short of a length outside off, left alone
and another. Between cover point and backward point this time. 152kph, overpitched and wide. Gets a nice connection on this drive, opens the face at the right moment
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of backward square. Awkward rising delivery at the underarm. Fends at it and gets a glove
length on off stump, defended into the off side with feet rooted in the crease
length and skidding on at a middle stump line. Defended into the leg side off the back foot
ramps it and finds four. Second time that he's forced a boundary against CDG. Skillful for sure, this guy. Length at off stump and he steps behind its line to lift it deftly past the keeper
length on off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
short outside off. Looks to pull it wide of mid-on, can't get past Henry's dive
length on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length and slanted down leg side
length outside off, leans in and runs it straight to backward point
full and in at off stump. Jabbed to mid-off with static feet

short ball, 152.4kph, in the corridor. Looks to dab it down to third man but Lockie's been bowling wide of the crease all day. The room for that shot is decreasing at every point after delivery. This one is jammed into the turf past off stump
short of a length, slanting in outside off again. Beaten on the edge as he looks to run this down as well
short and up at the hips. Hurriedly clips this past backward square leg
short at leg stump, gets inside the line and swishes uppishly to fine leg
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
beaten in flight but he's down the track and drives this in the gap. That dipped on him outside off and he was driving after it had turned away. Single at sweeper
short and just outside off. Cut to sweeper's left

stumping appeal down leg side as Sabbir slips attempting a sweep. Lost his footing...and he is short as he looks to get the back bat in. That's unfortunate. It's a length ball down leg. His front heel slips on the surface as he chases this. He's in a tangle with both feet out of the crease and his body on the floor. Panic as he looks to sweep the bat along the ground and into the crease. Latham's taken some time with that stumping, but there's enough going against Sabbir for him to be marginally short
full on off stump, driven to extra cover
lifts it over mid-on. Safe, in theory. Length ball at off stump. Steps out and hits it on the up, against the turn
shot. Full and just outside off. Leans in nicely on the front foot and caresses this between cover and short extra. Gorgeous
short of a length on off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
short at off stump, looks to steal a single after dropping this pitch side with soft hands. Cover fielder too quick
short and down leg side, left alone
length and in at off stump. Opens the face and runs it down to third man
length on off stump, defended into the covers
short and in the corridor. Defended to point's left with soft hands
oh geez. It's not quite a Lockie spell without one of these. Wide of the crease and, eventually, wide of the keeper. This pitches outside leg and sails down to the fine leg boundary.
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and angled in at off stump, punched to long-off on the back foot
length on leg stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
floaty length ball, drifting in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
flat and pushed down leg side. Gets just inside the line and tickles this fine
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
shot. But only one. Dropped short outside off and punched firmly off the back foot to sweeper's left
short ball wide outside off. Beaten on the pull
length ball cutting in from middle stump. Looks to flick, cops it on the pad
length and wide outside off, beaten on the slash
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
well done. Big stride down the pitch and a clean swing on the slog sweep. Length at middle, gets the leg just leg side of the line of the ball and picks it up over deep midwicket
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
overpitched outside off, looks to drive, can't beat extra cover's dive to the left
tossed up wide outside off. Gets down, reaches out, and paddles it to short fine's right
short of a length on leg stump, whipped straight to midwicket off the back foot
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length and down leg side, beaten on the flick
length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
full and just outside off, driven to mid-off
slower ball at a length on middle stump. Shuffles across and tickles this fine. He was right in front of middle stump as he played this
length on off stump, defended to point
length at leg stump. Overbalances and flicks to fine leg
short and just outside off, cut straight to point
length o off stump, punched to long-off
length outside off, driven back to the bowler on the up
full outside off, gets his front leg into the leg side and drives to sweeper cover
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

Santner wins the battle! They're both intelligent cricketers, Santner and Mehidy. Mehidy's footwork was top-class so far and he was maneuvering Santner all over and picking him off. Almost as a pattern, all of Santner's sixth balls were quicker, but this time he hangs it up wide outside off on a length. Mehidy wants to sweep to the backward square boundary after shuffling, but his top-edge is easy for short fine to get to with a jog to the left. Neesham there
short and wide outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and in at the thigh. Deflected behind square with an attempted flick
length and just outside off. Gets behind the line and runs this to third man
length at leg stump, rapped on the pads as he looks to defend
length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
overpitched on leg stump, beaten on the flick, cops it on the pad
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right off the back foot
length and just outside off. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
length on off stump, dropped into the square leg region with soft hands
short and just outside off, zipping in. Arm ball. But he makes room by getting deep in the crease and chops this past point

top edge short of third man. Don't think Saifuddin has ever faced Lockie before, but that doesn't stop him from running down at him and heaving at it. Length ball, wide outside off. Can't control the attempted slog
length outside off, jabs it down to third man
yorker just outside off, can't get his bat down quickly enough. It curves away marginally and beats the outside edge
length and just outside off. Defended to cover off the back foot

shot! Supern fielding from Guptill at midwicket. Length and angled in at middle stump. Gets his head right on top of this with a half step forward. Flicks neatly with the angle but can't beat the dive
length at leg stump, uses the angle to flick to fine leg
length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off. Some extra bounce on this as he looks to carve to third man. Beaten on the outside edge
short of a length on leg stump, walks at it and tickles it to fine leg
short and down leg side. Just manages bat on this pull as it slides down. Fine leg cleans up
short of a length just outside off, run down to third man with an open face
angling in a bit too much, clipped away to fine leg easily
bangs one into the pitch outside off, he watches it go to the keeper
almost an action replay, a bouncer outside off, but this one's a wide for its height
follows up the bouncers with a full delivery on off, Saifuddin tries to turn it to leg but it shapes away and takes an edge to fly away to third man, because of the pace
quick and wide outside off, he sticks his bat out and the ball falls short of Taylor at gully. Taylor's finger takes a blow again
outside off again, driven through the covers for one
tries the yorker, it's a low full toss on leg and clipped away to deep midwicket for two in the gap
bit short and wide, he slashes and gets runs square of the wicket
135.6kmh, angling away from just outside off, the angle and pac beat the outside edge
full on off stump, driven down with a straight bat to mid-off
on the pads this time, good pace and he takes it on the pads, missing the ball while trying to tuck it to leg
gives the charge for the ball outside off, and smashes it over the covers right off the middle of the bat
slower bouncer around 120kmh outside off, bounces once again before the keeper as Saifuddin lets it go
starts with a short ball towards the throat, he hangs back and defends carefully
short again, this time more towards leg and he pulls it away for one
short to Saifuddin as well, he lifts his right leg a bit awkwardly while staying back and swats it towards square leg
slower one at 118kmh on the stumps, full as well, he pushes it into the covers for a quick single
full on off again, tucked away to deep square leg for one more
ends the over with a short ball that Mithun pulls nicely while getting on top of it, deep midwicket goes to his left and slides to keep it to two
fullish outside off, driven away nicely into the covers
slower at 116.5kmh and back of length outside off, Mithun waits before guiding it late and fine on the off side and wants two
back to 132kmh now and on good length on off, defended back this time
bit short and wide, he slashes but doesn't middle it this time and finds point
much closer to off and tighter length, Mithun steers it to point where a dive saves the single
errs down the leg side past the pads for a wide
length ball, on off stump, no room and he defends it back
slightly short outside off with some room and he finds point
dances down to smash the short ball with a horizontal bat but it bounces over him. Big swing and a miss
full on the off stump this time and it's clipped with the wrists to mid-on
a single finally as Boult pitches this one towards the pads with a full length and Saifuddin helps it to fine leg

almost a run-out as Mithun drives it to cover and wants a run, but Neesham dives full length to his right to snare the ball. Has a shy at the stumps at the keeper's end with Mithun still well outside, but he misses. They get an overthrow
ends the over with a yorker, he jams his bat down to block it
on length on the off side and he steers it just wide of point for a quick single
135kmh, some room outside off, he goes for a bit shot on the leg side but doesn't middle and finds mid-on
tighter line on off stump, he waits this time and steers it straight to point
that looked like a cutter on the off stump, Saifuddin tried to clip it to leg but couldn't time it properly. Scrambled seam, actually
just a bit too short now and he pulls for a single
slow offcutter around off, he waits before punching it square but point dives to his left to save a few

edged and that just goes over Latham's gloves, it actually hit Latham's left glove. A short ball from Henry took the outside edge and Latham went for the jump but the bounce made sure it didn't land in his gloves
fuller this time and Saifuddin slams it down wide of mid-on, but he dives to his left and NZ save some runs again
makes a lot of room and Henry chases him with what would have been a leg-side delivery, and Saifuddin cuts it wide of point for one

short of length delivery outside off, he defends and reaches his fifty with an inside edge to the leg side. His third half-century in ODIs, and first outside Asia. He's not far from his high sore of 63
hint of room on the off side and Saifuddin punches it straight to point
tempts him with a wide delivery outside off, he chases and misses
much closer to off now, he cuts but finds point
much slower drought he air and on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
quicker at 96kmh and full on off, helps it down to long-on
around length outside off and he makes some room to slash it into the covers for one
backs away a long way well before Santner delivers, he pitches it wide outside off and it's struck to sweeper cover
length delivery on the off stump, clipped towards midwicket for one
short ball at good pace, he sways out of the line in time
length ball on the stumps, he slogs wildly and finds fine leg with a thick inside edge
tucks the short of length ball with the angle towards square leg
he goes for the pull against the short ball, gets a top-edge and luckily for Saifuddin, it flies over the slip region for a four
fuller and on the pads now, clipped away for one
slightly quick on the pads, flicked to the leg side for one
walks towards the off stump, Santner pitches it wide and he slams it down towards long-off
goes towards then, then off, Santner pitches it pretty wide outside off under the sweep and it's not called a wide
a soft reverse sweep for the ball on middle, straight to short third man
marches towards the off side again and then goes for a big drive but misses
back of length outside off, he stays in the crease and punches it off the back foot. Really good timing to send it behind point for four
in the block hole this time and it's blocked back
full again and this time it's driven down to long on for one

misses the slash outside off, Latham misses it too after it bounces just before him. Oh, the ball has rolled away from under Latham and probably gone on to hit the helmet. The third umpire is checking if Latham pushed the ball away just in time before it hit the helmet or not
low full toss on off, clipped away bit straight to midwicket
slow full toss this time and he smashes it over midwicket, in the gap, and it's gone for four

swept away hard from outside off, Boult dives to his right to stop, it's still rolling away towards the rope, he gets up and keeps it back again, it's still rolling away and another fielder finally comes to the rescue this time
hint of room and it's cut into the off side
drives the length ball straight to cover
almost in the block hole, tucked away with hard hands wide of long on and they come back for two
looking for quick runs, he sweeps it hard but sends it straight to Guptill at midwicket. It was a bit slow and very wide outside off, he went down on a knee and slammed it for a straightforward catch
no room for Mashrafe, he stays still and blocks the length ball back
short and wide, cuts fiercely but straight to point
fuller this time on off, drives it wide of point for a quick single
full on off again, trying for the block hole, and it's steered straight to point
makes a bit of room and scythes the full ball along the ground on the off side in the gap
it works this time as he makes room for the short ball and then crouches back to ramp the ball with the pace over the slip region for a clever boundary
in the block hole, the inside edge just misses the stumps as Mithun wants the single. A fielder swoops in quickly and has a shy at the bowler's end with a direct hit but Mashrafe has made it
backs away and drives the full ball firmly towards long off for one
attempted yorker on off, it's a low full toss, and the ball is steered towards point where Nicholls puts in a dive to his right
slower ball outside off, he goes for a big swing and misses
this time towards the leg side because Boult has been seeing him back away, Mashrafe doesn't connect but gets two leg byes, fine on the leg side
tries to pull, doesn't connect again and another leg bye on the leg side
wide outside off, far away from the batsman, who steers it along the ground to sweeper cover
150kmh, beaten for pace! Goes for a wild heave for the length delivery angling in from wide of the crease, he slogs but the bat comes down pretty late and the stumps are rattled
no footwork whatsoever, on length outside off and he gets bat on that
targets the off stump this time, the batsman moves away a bit and helps it to cover point

appeal from Latham and Ferguson for caught behind as Mustafizur tried to get some bat on it. He was beaten for pace too, it was a little short, and there was some noise for sure and HotSpot confirms it was the back shoulder, in fact. Good decision from S Ravi
fullish on the stumps and it's pushed down to mid-on
he wants to nail the yorker, it's a low full toss and Mashrafe finds midwicket
full outside off this time, Mashrafe simply jams his bat down towards mid-off
backs away and then moves across to the off side, Boult ends up sending down a high full toss on the off side for a no ball
low full toss outside off, Mashrafe only steers it to short third man. Opportunity lost!
goes across to off to scoop this time and this one is well down leg for a wide
straighter delivery for a change and it's lofted down the ground. They settle for one by the time long-off cuts it off
the yorker does it! Mustafizur had to face two balls for Mashrafe to face the last over but Boult's accurate yorker on middle and off finds the gap between bat and pad. It's all over
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket's left on the up
thick outside edge down to third man. Length at off stump, closes the face on it too early
length and in at middle stump. Poked to midwicket with the angle
length and in at leg stump. Cops it on the pad as he tries to flick this
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left off the front foot
full outswinger outside off. Angled bat drive to mid-off's right. Mashrafe with a tumbling stop there
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length with some late swing inwards. Raps him on the outside of his pad as he looks to flick
short of a length at off stump, defended to cover on the up
length ball slanted across off stump, left alone
length on leg stump, allows it to come on and flicks this handsomely in front of square
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, punched to mid-on's right on the rise
length and in at middle stump. Defended with the angle to midwicket
short of a length outside off, jabbed to mid-off on the rise
full and in at leg stump, looks to flick. It's off his front pad and in front of short fine
length at off stump, defended down the pitch off the front foot
length on middle stump, punched against the angle to mid-on
length ball swung down leg side, can't connect on the flick
length at leg stump, looks to flick, cops it on the thigh pad
length on off stump, punched on the rise to mid-off
length and slanted in at leg stump. Allows it to come on and flicks to the backward square leg boundary
low full toss outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
full and down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
full and in at middle stump, driven to mid-on off the inside half
length on off stump, tapped down the pitch off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, cramps him. No option but to punch this to mid-off
length and in at middle stump, nudged to mid-on with the angle
nicely timed, but mid-off backs the bowler's discipline. Length outside off and he gets nice connection on this back foot punch. Won't beat Liton's dive to the right
length on middle stump, flicked straight to mid-on off the front foot
length at leg stump, shuffles and clips it deftly to deep square's left
134kph, short of a length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
135.4kph, short of a length on leg stump, clipped straight to midwicket
119kph, short of a length offcutter, from leg stump. Defended into the off side
length on middle stump, poked to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
length on middle stump. Another offcutter. Defended into the off side on the front foot
full and in at middle stump. Looks to drive through cover, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
length on leg stump, clipped to deep backward square
length on off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
length at the stumps, nudged into the leg side
length on off stump, tapped on the up to mid-off
136kph, short outside off. Springs into it with a pull, but can't get it past midwicket
lovely. The bad ball he's been waiting for. A bit too full from Fizz, and angled in towards leg stump. He gets his weight into the and punches it past Guptill
slower ball at a length outside off. Inside-edge onto pad as he gets forward.  Confident call from Guptill to steal a single from point
short of a length offcutter on middle stump, defended off the back foot
offcutter at a length on middle stump. Defended to cover point on the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, climbs on top of it and tucks it to deep square
length and wide outside off. Sticks in the pitch a little as he chucks his hands at this to drive through the off side. Off the toe-end
full and in at middle stump, leans in and clips neatly to deep square's left

oh yeah. That's the Guptill people pay to watch. Offcutter at a length on off, gets the big stride down, hits through the line and dead straight. The Guptill no-look launch over the bowler. What a sight.
length on leg stump, tapped to deep square with the angle
length and in at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length and in at leg stump. Rapped on the thigh guard as he looks to flick

misses the stumps and puts Mustafizur in danger of missing the series too. Length at middle stump, tapped towards mid-off where Liton is quick on the ball and has a nice bounce on it to pick that up. His throw is wildly over the stumps and headed straight for the bowler's mid-riff as he backs up. Guptill was hurring down there
length outside off, stabbed to third man's left
slower ball at off stump, blocked into the covers, away from the body
offcutter at a length outside off. Defended down the pitch
length and in at leg stump, clipped to deep square off the back foot

thick edge between point and wide gully! He's been setting him up for that but Guptill survives. Length ball, a ripping offcutter outside off. First driving ball he's offered and the batsman takes the bait. Not to the pitch of this and the extra bounce doesn't allow him to control this shot
length outside off, driven on the rise to extra cover
length outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
length outside off, driven on the up, point leaps to his left to stop
length and in at middle stump. Tapped towards mid-on
length on middle stump, allows it to come on and clips to deep square's right with the angle
length and just outside off. Back foot punch past bowler and mid-off. Long-on cleans up
short of a length on off stump, defended to point off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, jammed into the pitch as he's hurried on the back foot punch
offcutter at a length on off stump, looks to flick, inside edge onto thigh
short and wide outside off, swish and miss
length outside off, nicely timed square drive, straight to backward point
short of a length offcutter in the corridor. Digs it into the turf with a back foot punch
inside edge trickles past the stumps. Looking for a big drive through the off side again at a length ball. Too early on it again
short of a length wide outside off, chopped on the rise to sweeper cover
full and in at middle stump, driven to long-on
length on middle stump, punched on the up to the bowler
length on off stump, tapped on the up towards mid-off, who loses his footing as he runs in for a half-chance
length on off stump, tapped to cover off the back foot

run-out chance fluffed! Oh that's poor cricket from the batsmen first, and then Bangladesh in the field. Length at leg stump, tucked to deep square's right. Guptill is not ready for the second and responds late. The throw is released late and with no power. Two bounces to the bowler, who is in front of stumps and misses as he looks to flick this onto the stumps at the non-striker's
length at the stumps, tapped through square leg
shot. Full, hooping in at middle stump. Nice stride into it, full face offered, and whistles past the umpire's right ear
full outside off, mistimed drive on the up to sweeper cover
misfield gives them four extra runs. Full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off's left where Mahmudullah gets in a terrible position. On his backside as he sticks out a lazy left hand at this
short and wide, cut straight to point
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length ball skidding in at middle stump. Hurriedly tapped back to the bowler
length outside off, backs away and taps to sweeper's left
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
length outside off, looks to drive on the up, gets an inside edge into the leg side
short of a length outside off, backs away and cuts to mid-off
length at off stump, hurriedly pushed back to the bowler
length and in at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's right off the back foot
length on off stump, driven on the rise to mid-off
length on off stump, nervous half-stride as he realises this is a legbreak sliding in from Sabbir. Inside edge onto pad
another legbreak slider. Middle stump. Pushed into the leg side off the front foot
turning in from off, driven down to long-on for one
towards Nicholls' pads and he tucks it wide of short fine leg for one
shorter delivery this time on off, pushed down to long-off again
flighted a lot more around off, he makes room and drives it through the covers
pitched up, driven straight down to mid off
full on off again, the bowler dives to his left to stop the drive back from Guptill
pitched up on off, no room and he pushes it back
full again, driven with more power just missing the non-striker's stumps this time for one to long-on
too short, there are short boundaries too, and Guptill rocks back seeing this long hop to pull it for six over the midwicket boundary
pretty full on leg, pushed down to long-on rather easily
short and flat from outside off, slapped back to the bowler
plenty of room outside off, he slashes hard and get a thick bottom edge to short third man
on length outside off, he pushes it back
bit slower and closer to off stump, Nicholls comes closer to the line of the ball and sweeps that away just past the square-leg umpire and the ball curves further to beat the fielder in the deep
reverse paddle deflects off the keeper's gloves, very tough to call that a drop but it did touch the gloves. Nicholls actually hit it off the back of the bat
pushes the delivery down to long-on this time
turning in, tucked towards midwicket and no time for a run
slams the length delivery back to the bowler, it deflects off his leg and to the leg side for a single
full on middle, pushed with the turn to long off
a low full toss for Nicholls and he flicks it to leg for one more
in the block hole from Sabbir, blocked back by Guptill
full on the pads now, tucked away to deep midwicket for a single
too short and wide outside off, it's a bit quick for Nicholls to send it past cover
closer to the stumps this time and it's helped with the turn to long-on
enough room outside off for Nicholls to cut it wide of third man for two in the gap
uses hard hands to find cover point this time
bit too short, and this time he rocks back to slam it between cover point and cover for a four that brings up his half-century, his seventh in ODIs
the full delivery is pushed back to the bowler
shorter towards the stumps now and Nicholls goes deep in the crease to punch it to long-on. Brings up the team's 100
was that a chance? It turned past Guptill's pads into the keeper's gloves, popped out of them and there seemed to be some noise, could be of the bat. Not a wide signalled so could have been a chance
starts with a low full toss and it's worked to leg for one
works the fullish delivery to the leg side
tossed up, driven down to long-off easily
a lot of room on off tempts Nicholls who cuts the ball to short third man. A bit of fumble but they don't want to risk a single
pretty full and it's worked towards deep midwicket
goes on the back foot and defends the ball back
pushes the full delivery back to the bowler
makes some room and drives the ball to point

oh, that's a strange dismissal and Nicholls has softly dragged one back onto the stumps. He stepped out to push the ball before it could turn but the ball took an edge, deflected off the pads and then rolled back to hit the stumps. The opening stand of 103 is broken
well on the leg side, tucked to square leg
touch shorter on the leg side and it's steered to square leg again
darts this one straighter and Williamson blocks. Thats' a wicket maiden
towards the pads and Guptill drives to long-on
tosses it up outside off, he drives it to cover
drifting in towards off now, he blocks it back

gets off the mark with such a risky single! He flicked the ball to leg where midwicket put in a dive to his left and the ball deflected off him to make Williamson want a single and the fielder got to the ball again quickly to his left but couldn't manage a direct hit
the shorter delivery is pushed down to long on and that's Guptill's 35th ODI fifty. Good innings for him after those low scores against India
charges down to get to the pitch of the ball and lofts that away to the long-on boundary to collect four runs
pretty wide outside off, Guptill chases with hard hands and slashes that wide of extra cover's left, right in the gap for four
clips this ball with the turn to long on
shorter delivery on the pads, worked away towards square leg
bit slower around off and he defends it back
leans into the length ball this time and pushes it to long on
he closes the face of the bat to clip it to leg but the ball holds its line a bit to take a thick outside edge and run towards third man
pretty full around leg, swept away behind square for a quick one
to full, and that's right in Guptill's arc to smash it back over the bowler's head with a lot of power for a four
touch slower and he defends it into the covers
waits for this one to turn and he steers it towards point for a single
not much turn and Williamson goes on the back foot to steer that to deep cover
the wrong'un turns in a bit, no trouble as Guptill picks it and punches it in the covers
thick outside edge as Guptill drives and the ball goes behind square on off
pushes this length ball back towards the bowler
bit too short and it's tucked straight to midwicket
uses the high backlight to drive that down to long-on for one more
goes back to cover the stumps and then uses his wrists to work it to leg with the spin
bit slower in the air and Guptill pushes it back
thick edge hits Williamson's foot as he punches the short of length ball off the back foot
covers the stumps this time to block with a straight bat
just outside off and he pushes it down to mid-off
walks towards the line of the ball outside off and defends it off the middle on off
covers the stumps again and drives the ball back to the bowler with a straight bat
nipping in sharply this time and Williamson uses the angle to help it to fine leg
helps the ball with the turn to long-on easily

short and flat on the stumps, Guptill moves across early and paddle-sweeps it fine, Mustafizur goes for the chase and tries to slide and stop with his ankle but can't. Thankfully he didn't hurt his ankle there
uses the wrists to work this one to leg off middle and leg
slower in the air around off, Williamson waits and defends carefully

loud appeal for lbw as that keeps really low and hit him right in front of the stumps. Umpire doesn't call it out so Bangladesh review immediately . It was short so Williamson went back and opened up to swat it on the leg side but the ball didn't bounce much and struck the front pad right in front, ball-tracking says it would have hit leg stump
nicely flighted outside off, Taylor leans forward and blocks
punches it off the front foot into the covers
strange appeal for lbw as Guptill flicks that inswinging full delivery from middle stump for a single. The bat might have hit the pad or the ball might have deflected off the pad
angling in sharply, helped to square leg to get off the mark
right in the block hole this time and Guptill digs it out
pulls the length back this time and Guptill drives it down to long-on
angling in towards the batsman, worked away towards deep midwicket
drives that ball into the covers in the gap and gets one
leans forward and uses soft hands to push the ball around cover point and steals a quick single
on leg stump, clipped towards long-on easily
turning in and too close to cut, but Taylor tries and gets an edge onto his pads
flatter and quicker outside off on length, he defends it back
flighted on a teasing length outside off, he waits and the ball turns to take a thick inside edge to go to leg
pitched up on off stump and Guptill makes that look so easy by driving that nicely with a straight bat, straight down the ground over Taylor's head for four
a slower cutter at 123kmh but well outside leg, worked away to leg for one and the team 150 comes up
a slow cutter outside off on length, Taylor waits and pushes it down to mid-off
on the pads again and Taylor helps it between mid-on and midwicket for one
bangs it in much shorter outside off, Guptill guides it behind square on off by keeping it down
bit of hesitation initially but they complete the run easily after Taylor defends the 138kmh delivery on middle and leg to the leg side
nicely flighted outside off, he pushes it back to the bowler
little wider on off and he drives it into the covers for one
leans forward a bit and blocks the length delivery
cross-seamed delivery on length, and it's worked towards long-on
very slow and wide outside off, cuts it off the bak foot for one
turning in a bit and he defends it back carefully
length on off stump, defended into the off side
slower ball at a length just outside off, dabbed to gully
full and just outside off, leans in and taps to extra cover
full outside off, nudged to extra cover's left
length on leg stump, looks to flick and misses. Deflected off the thigh
slower ball at a length on off stump, defended into the covers with soft hands

length ball down leg side, looks to sweep and appears to have missed it. But Bangladesh have reviewed. For catch behind. And all the tech confirms there is no touch on that and Bangladesh lose their review.
length outside off, blocked on the front foot

lifts it over square leg. All the way! Full and pushed through quickly at a middle stump line. It's full enough that there isn't a lot of sweeping room. But he brings down quick arms at this and launches
length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
short and wide outside off. Backs away and cuts it past third man. Too short, too much room. And just as much gratitude from Taylor as he places this
off the body as he looks to evade this. Short of a length and jumps up at him as he shapes to cut. Down to third man
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and curving away at middle stump. Flicked to midwicket. A tight single taken. Might have been in trouble with a direct hit
length outside off, punched to sweeper's right on the up
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on middle stump, driven with the turn to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
low full toss fired in at middle stump. Punched towards long-on
full and just outside off, driven to extra cover
length on off stump, driven with the angle to long-off
length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
yorker at off stump, jammed back to the bowler
bouncer at a middle stump line. Ducks to let it pass
length and slanted in outside off. Looks to drive on the up, gets an inside edge to midwicket
yorker down leg side, can't get bat on it
short of a length outside off, hurried on the pull as he jumps onto the front foot. Off the inside half to midwicket
connects this time. Nothing pretty about this. Short of a length on off stump. Walks out, gets the front leg across and hoicks into the square leg boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
easy. He's bowling around the wicket with a leg side field. But he slings this full and very wide outside off. Massive gap between extra cover and backward point. Taylor taps it through there
yorker on middle stump, jammed back to the bowler
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
slashed straight to sweeper cover. That was sweetly hit. Length ball with some width and he lunged into it with a flat-bat, on the up
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man's right
full and in at leg stump, flicked straight to midwicket
swatted away. Short and up outside off. Jumps up after a forward press and gets this pull onto the ground and past midwcket
low full toss on middle stump, nudged to mid-on's right with a closed face
yorker just outside off, chopped to point on the bounce
short of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full on off, driven to long-off
short and wide outside. Late cut, can't get past Tamim's slide to the right

century No. 15 for Guptill, brought up with a drive to long-off. Full ball outside off, leans in nicely and gets it past the bowler. His second against Bangladesh. And his first score of greater than 20 since his last hundred, seven ODIs ago. Gets out of that slump
short, down leg side, stands tall and swats it to the long leg boundary. As if you could do anything else with that
length at off stump, defended into the off side
short and wide and slanted across him. Looks for the upper cut but is beaten
short of a length, looks like an offcutter, So this sits up unlike the previous ball. Time to cover the line and pull to the square leg boundary

sliced to the extra cover boundary. He was deceived there, but it's safe in the end. Full offcutter wide outside off. Reaches out and looks to carve it over mid-off, seemingly. But the bat turns in his hands as he's too early on this
short at the ribs, mistimed pull to midwicket
length outside off, punched to sweeper on the up
short and wide outside off. Looks to cut. Gets it off the toe-end to sweeper
overpitched outside off, driven firmly to cover's right. He dives and gets a hand on it, but can only parry it to his right
length outside off, punched back to the bowler
slower ball at a length outside off, mistimed punch on the up. Off the under-edge
length on leg stump, looks to flick, gets it off the thigh into the square leg region
length at off stump, defended to extra cover
short of a length outside off, chopped straight to point
length ball pushed down leg side, can't get bat on it
length on leg stump, nudged to midwicket
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
length on the pads, leans into it and tickles it fine
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length outside off, chopped to sweeper's left
length on off stump, defended into the off side
length on off stump, punched to extra cover on the up
he will not play nice! Full on middle stump, allows it to skid on and uses the angle to almost check-punch this in the end. A pick up over the midwicket boundary with a subdued follow through
that's 1-0 to New Zealand. Length ball angled in at leg stump, stays big on it and punches into the leg side off the back foot
